intro: Phelipanche pallens var. karatavica, commonly known as the Karatavica morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its seeds are small and can remain viable in the soil for many years, contributing to its persistence in certain habitats. The species is also noted for its potential as a ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display.
